findings.rationale: Limiting liability to fees paid may expose parties to significant risks, especially in cases of negligence or breach.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party's liability is limited to the total fees paid under this Agreement in the preceding calendar year.

findings.rationale: The indemnification clause may not fully protect against third-party claims, leading to potential financial exposure.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party shall indemnify the other to the extent required by applicable law for claims arising from its own breach.

findings.rationale: Three years may be insufficient for certain sensitive information, risking potential leaks or misuse.
findings.evidence_quote: Confidentiality obligations continue for 3 years after termination of this Agreement.

findings.rationale: Relying on good faith negotiation may lead to prolonged disputes without formal mechanisms for resolution.
findings.evidence_quote: Disputes shall be resolved through good faith negotiation between authorized representatives.

findings.rationale: Each party bearing its own legal expenses may discourage claims or defenses due to potential financial burdens.
findings.evidence_quote: Each party bears its own legal expenses in connection with any dispute.
